alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 8:46PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gilchrist, southwestern Alachua and south central Columbia Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 845 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near High Springs, or 9 miles east of Bell, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... High Springs, Archer and Newberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
